Description: Upper part of a terracotta figurine or model group in the iconography of Zeus-Ammon (or perhaps Pan) but probably the Great God of Cyprus; hollow, mould-made; beared male with horns, wearing a cape knotted around the chest, over a pleated tunic; cornucopia in his left hand, his right arm down by the side. Made of find buff clay with traces of a white wash over the surface, which is very worn. The nose is brokn away.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: J A R Munro
Curator's comments: For the iconography of the Great God of Cyprus, see Buchholz 1991, Sophocleous 1985, Counts 2009. Bibliography: Buchholz H.-G. 1991, 'Der Gott Hammon und Zeus Hammon auf Zypern', AM 106, 85-108. Counts D. 2009, 'From Siwa to Cyprus: The assimilation of Zeus Ammon in the Cypriote pantheon', in eds D. Michaelides et al, Egypt and Cyprus in Antiquity (Oxford and Oakville), 104-17. Sophocleous S. 1985, Atlas des représentations Cypro-Archaïques des divinités. SIMA Pocket-Book 33 (Göteborg).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (A438)
Associated names: Representation of: Great God of Cyprus (?)
